entry.title: Join the Runner H "AI Agent Prompting" Challenge: $10,000 in Prizes for 20 Winners!!!
How to Use @PropertySource in Your Spring Application
entry.summary:
What is the @PropertySource annotation?
The @PropertySource annotation is used to tell Spring to load a specific properties file from a location provided in the annotation. It is used in conjunction with @Configuration at the class level. It allows you, as a developer, to externalize the configuration of your application. @PropertySource?
It allows you to load properties files from any location. In Java 8+, you can repeat this annotation many times, allowing you to load multiple configuration files. It supports the usage of placeholders using Spring Expression Language syntax. You can handle missing files by ignoring them if they are not found. Property override: if you have many properties with the same name, the last definition will override the first one. @PropertySource
The firsâ€¦

entry.title: BrightData's MCP: Fetching Real-time Web Data For LLMs
entry.summary:
In the world of artificial intelligence, especially large language models (LLMs), there's a quiet revolution happening. It's called Model Context Protocol, or simply MCP. You may have encountered the term in AI communities or tool integrations, but what exactly is MCP, and why should you care? Letâ€™s break it down, step by step, and show you how this simple yet powerful concept is solving one of the biggest headaches in AI, which is accessing real-time web data.
What Is MCP (Model Context Protocol)?
Imagine youâ€™ve trained a brilliant AI that knows history, science, programming, and can even write poetry. But ask it whatâ€™s trending on Twitter or what the latest YouTube comments are on a viral video, and youâ€™ll likely get outdated, static responses. Why? Because LLMs are not buâ€¦

entry.title: Credential Dumping Applications: What They Are, How They Work, and How to Defend Against Them
entry.summary: Credential dumping is a common post-exploitation technique used by attackers to harvest user credentials from a compromised system. By extracting usernames and passwords stored in memory or on disk, attackers can move laterally within a network, escalate privileges, and access sensitive systems and data. In this article, weâ€™ll explore what credential dumping applications are, how they work, popular tools used in real-world attacks, and how you can defend against them. Continue read in Medium

entry.title: Why Your Perfect Lighthouse Score Doesn't Mean Your Site is Fast
entry.summary:
Great Lighthouse scores, but users still complain your site is slow? You're not alone. Here's a shocking reality check: Google's research found that 50% of websites with perfect Lighthouse scores still fail Core Web Vitals when measured with real user data. Half! That means half the developers celebrating perfect synthetic scores are actually delivering poor performance to their real users. Lighthouse and PageSpeed Insights run in perfect, controlled environments. They simulate an "85th percentile user" â€” but their simulation is usually wrong for your specific audience. Real-world variables synthetic tests miss: Network packet loss and latency spikes Device thermal throttling during extended use Background apps competing for resources
Browser extensions affecting performance User behaviorâ€¦

entry.title: ðŸ”¬ Internals of PostgreSQL WAL Streaming with pgrwl: A Cloud-Native Receiver Built in Go
entry.summary: PostgreSQL's Write-Ahead Logging (WAL) underpins everything from crash recovery to PITR and streaming replication. But streaming WALs safely and reliably, especially into cloud or container-native environments, can be fragile. Enter pgrwl: a modern WAL receiver written in Go that gives you: ðŸ“† WAL streaming to local/S3/SFTP ðŸ” On-the-fly encryption + compression ðŸ³ Kubernetes-native workflows ðŸ“Š Prometheus metrics + Grafana dashboards ðŸ§¹ Automatic retention + cleanup âš™ï¸ Safe WAL handling, with proper fsync guarantees Letâ€™s explore how it works under the hood. ðŸ§ª Note: pgrwl is a research project, inspired by PostgreSQLâ€™s built-in tools like pg_receivewal, and is official source code and streaming behaviors. pgrwl serves as a starting point to explore more cloud-native, container-friendly, â€¦

entry.title: Wanted to create App for free?
entry.summary:
I am 22 and 3rd year CS undergrade. Always Wanted to make my own apps but one thing that stopping me (other then that i didn't know to build Apps) was Money you have to pay fee to publish app on Play store or App store. Then I introduced you to progressive web apps (read about it below). Now i can make Apps with zero money. Thanks GOD Story
My semester breaks are going on and I decided to do something productive so participated in an hackathon. It was about spreading awareness about finance and economy. Thought finance is always boring what if i can create an app where people can learn in fun way So let me introduce you to FinLingo financial quiz app. Simple but effective. Tech Stack i used: PWA (progressive web apps) : applications that you build by using web technologies, and that can be installed and can run on all devices, from one codebase. PWAs provide native-like experiences to your users on supporting devices.
In short you can build an APP at once and can be used in any platforms (mac, linux, windows, Android, ios). Also no need to worry about publishing fee (It's completely free).
Next.js : For both frontend + Backend. It can be use for full-stack development. SEO friendly.
Supabase : To Store my app data. An SQL database.
This is how i created my first App for free and you can do the same. here. Thanks! for reading till end.

As someone who is going deeper and deeper into networking, and plans to work remotely, figuring out SDN and how it can benefit organizations--even legacy ones--is a big win for me. software-defined networking (SDN) â€” an architecture that abstracts the â€œcontrolâ€ of the network from the physical hardware and moves it into software, giving IT teams the flexibility, speed, and insight todayâ€™s digital initiatives demand. (techtarget.com)
Is SDN?
Simply speaking, SDN separates the control plane (the brains) from the data plane (the muscle). A centralized SDN controller progrâ€¦
